pullRequest.body:
We compute the cardinality of the projectivization of a finite vector space over a finite field.

From "Formalizing the Bruhat-Tits tree"

Co-authored-by: Judith Ludwig <ludwig@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12444286419/job/34744412621)

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12444559708/job/34744950197)
I merged master, @riccardobrasca could you please give this one another `bors merge`?
bors merge
maintainer merge
maintainer merge

(untested)

```suggestion
lemma two_le_card [Finite K] : 2 â‰¤ Nat.card K :=
  Finite.one_lt_card
```

This should work for any type which is `Finite` and `Nontrivial` (which automatically holds for `Field`). Maybe you want to add `Finite.two_le_card` instead.
Indeed, this lemma is just nonsense, I don't know what I was thinking. Thanks!
This should also hold without the finiteness assumptions, right? The equality would just reduce to `0 = 0`.
Or do we want an infinite version? I think if `Infinite k`, then `#V = #(â„™ k V) * #k` (modulo some `Cardinal.lift`), which should come from your `nonZeroEquivProjectivizationProdUnits`.

Violeta, I removed the `Finite` assumptions, thanks for the suggestion.
@acmepjz I think there is no real gain of having this over `nonZeroEquivProjectivizationProdUnits`?

> I think there is no real gain of having this over `nonZeroEquivProjectivizationProdUnits`?

Indeed. Feel free to ignore my blindness suggestion...
Could you please also add the generalization $\sum_{i < r} q^i$, where `r` is the rank and `q` is the cardinality of `k`?
Done, thanks for the suggestion

pullRequest.title: feat(LinearAlgebra/Projectivization): cardinality over finite fields
